Caption: 1 Recto: Sailing boat holding Aphrodite and Paris
Helen on 1 Verso: Helen with two attendants urn:cite:hmt:msA.1v
Helen (2) on 1 Verso: Helen with two attendants
Scene on bottom of 1 Verso: Aphrodite, Paris, and Helen sailing for Troy
Archer on 4 Recto: Apollo brings on the pestilence
Animal on 4 Verso: Scavangers devour the corpses of the dead
Achilles on 4 Verso: Achilles and the Myrmidons
Four Figures led by a Horseman on 6 Recto: The Horseman leads the group containing two soliders leading two women, possibly Chryseis and Briseis
Three Figures on 6 Recto: Chrsyseis being presented to Agamemnon
Two Figures on 6 Recto: Briseis being present to Achilles
Upper Image on 6 Verso: Chrsyses asks Agamemnon for the return of his daughter
Lower Image on 6 Verso: Chrsyses prays for Apollo to bring a pestilence upon the Greeks
9 Recto: Marriage banquet of Peleus and Thetis and the three goddesses prior to the Judgment of Paris
Upper Image on 9 Verso: Hermes leads the goddesses to Mt. Ida for the Judgment of Paris
Lower Image on 9 Verso: The Judgment of Paris
